alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wallace; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 7:24PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Wichita, southern Wallace, southwestern Logan and northeastern Greeley Counties through 700 PM MDT/800 PM CDT/... At 624 PM MDT/724 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles southeast of Sharon Springs, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Wichita, southern Wallace, southwestern Logan and northeastern Greeley Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT/1100 PM CDT/ for west central Kansas.
